title: Port Mirroring
description: Port mirroring is used on a network switch to send a copy of network packets seen on one switch port (or an entire VLAN) to a network monitoring connection on another switch port.
key-ideas: Operates at layer 2 (data link); almost always associated with switches (and not bridges or hubs).
Copies all traffic from specified interfaces to a single isolated interface.
Used by IDSs and network monitors to view and aggregate traffic that would otherwise be logically segmented by VLANs.
